reviewText:
I have crossfire AMD cards. Looks like I will be screwed over twice. :(

Framerate freezes every 5 to 10 secs for me, almost unplayable. The limited graphics options is laughable.

*update*
updated my graphics card driver but still getting stuttering at first...

edited the ini file to remove the 30fps limit which is BS. Plus a few other optimization settings, why they didn't include it in the graphics option menu is beyond me since it is pretty basic like msaa and bloom enable/disable etc.

tried to disable motionblur but that just crashes my game. so have to re-enable it and try to live with it. I hate motion blur btw.

OK! now the game is in a playable state. hardly any stuttering anymore except a little bit during cutscenes, don't know why.

From what I read crossfire is not enabled for AMD.

reviewText: Hi guys! I think I should tell you straight-up: Arkham Knight is a FANTASTIC video game. If you don't mind 30 FPS and have an Xbox One or Playstation 4, I highly recommend you get it on those platforms! Unfortunately, you're reading this review on the Steam digital distribution service for personal computers, which I assume means you're gathering info on what the game would be like if you bought it from Steam. The answer to that is: It's dogshit!\n\nDuring the long hiatus where it was unavailable for purchase, Arkham Knight received one patch that addressed bugs and performance towards the end of September, and that was it. While improvements were made, the game's performance is still quite poor, and many of the errors that plagued launch haven't been fully fixed! Rain effects still don't work the way they do on consoles! As those of us in the biz" like to say: Man

reviewText: Originally I gave this review as a thumbs down beacause it was flooded with a thousands of performance issues. Fortunately most of them has been fixed, but certanly not all. Truly the best of the series on those fronts.

reviewText: Definitely the worst port I have ever played. The reviews are all truthful in how poorly it runs. The stuttering is out of control making me think that the game has frozen in some parts, mostly when the batmobile is involved or I am gliding. The  stuttering can in some cases then throw the audio out of sync in cutscenes by as long as a few seconds. A lot of textures on walls, doors, or panels don't fill in making it look like it has textures out of the ps2 era. There are the least amount of graphical options I have seen in a PC game.\nIn terms of an Arkham game, it is mediocre at best. Nothing of the story all that compelling and the game seems much more empty than other Arkham games. The emphasis on outside environments rather than strategic indoor sequences that actually made me feel like Batman in the other games make this game lack in memorable Batman sequences. Overall, this game needs a decrease in price and Rocksteady and Iron Galaxy should be absolutely ashamed in how horrible this port is and how they have treated PC games as second class gamers.

reviewText:
I am really, really disappointed with the performance of this game. Forced 30fps framerate cap? No SLI profile at launch? No graphic options to disable motion blur? Right now this game is playing horrendously on powerful hardware. Not OK. It's obvious the PC version of this game got very little love by the dev team. For a AAA game, this completely unacceptable. The new nVidia driver even states that there are SLI optimizations. This is an outright lie. I forced alternate frame rendering in the control panel only to have FPS drops that made the game virtually unplayable. I've since disabled SLI and am using the second GPU for PhysX only. Playing with everything maxed out at 2560 x 1440, the framerate ranges from 15-55 fps, and it is all over the place. The game itself seems like it would be great if the performance wasn't giving me a headache from stuttering and everything else.

Thanks, Obama.

UPDATE: I feel like I need to add that the game is amazing fun. After many, many .ini file tweaks and nVidia tweaks, I have the game playing at a (fairly) stable 30-60fps. Obviously this large gap is still indicitive of a very poorly optimized, unfinished game, but I am at least able to play it. For those seeing the reviews on Steam and staying far away, I can recommend staying updated on patches and at least playing the game if Rocksteady ever manages to give the game any PC-version love.

It's the worst port of the best game of the year right now.

reviewText: Arkham Knight as of today's patch is still way too inferior to the console versions. Hold off purchasing until WB Games gives firm assurances that the remaining problems will be resolved. We're talking micro-stuttering, missing textures and graphic effects. collision detection, cheap on/off AA, severe performance drops in at least two areas of the game, one during a story-critical segment that makes it impossible to tell what is going on. Today's patch appears to have only added DLC support, not fixes which are much-needed. WB and Rocksteady are being very opaque over their plans for the future, or even if they are going to make the game run as it should on PC. The memory leak on Windows 10 is still there. The ambient rain effects bug caused by loading an existing save is still there. Ambient occulusion has a habit of not always appearing. SLI and Crossfire has still not been fixed and neither nVidia or AMD have released any driver updates for them. With there being no noticeable improvement since the September patch, it makes no sense why WB and Rocksteady would consider this to be fit for re-release but for the DLC finally being ready.\n\nUPDATE: I've started a new game to check some things out and will update this review soon.

reviewText:
The game has now been put back on sale, but the optimization is still absolutely awful. If you haven't got absolute top-of-the-line hardware, you're not going to consistently hit 60 fps.

Even if you decide to cap at 30 frames per second, the frame pacing/timing is off, resulting in stuttering and hitching. High textures makes the game run disgustingly slow - turning it in to a juddering, stuttering slideshow.

Also, according to their patch notes, the missing rain effects bug has been fixed, but that's not true. Rain effects are STILL missing after all this time.

For comparison, this is what we should have: http://i.imgur.com/98lwypo.gif

Instead, this is what we have: http://i.imgur.com/VcdpQRr.gif

I've given up any hope of this game being well and truly fixed. Whoever worked on this dogshit port clearly were either incapable of fixing it, or just weren't willing to put in the effort to fix it properly. I wouldn't be surprised if I learned that they spent most of their time getting the DLC working instead of improving the base game.

This is coming from a massive fan of the previous Arkham games. I'm utterly disappointed, and everyone involved in the making of this port should feel ashamed of themselves.

reviewText: The game itself is the worst Rocksteady Arkham game, but it is still good in its own right.\nThis port, however, even as of the 29th of October, is horribly optimized. If you like playing at a framerate above a cinematic 24fps, STAY AWAY FROM THIS ♥♥♥♥.
